title: Program Manager, Global Risk Onboarding Operations
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
Stripe’s mission is to increase the GDP of the internet: we build economic infrastructure for internet businesses of every size in pursuit of this mission. The Global Merchant Onboarding (GMO) team is responsible for operationalising the onboarding partner requirements for Stripe’s merchants globally. 
We are looking for an experienced program manager to join our GMO team, leading our efforts to further the mission of building operational processes to seamlessly onboard merchants to Stripe and building partner trust. In this role, you will be responsible for liaising with a variety of cross-functional internal and external stakeholders to identify and assess regulatory, contractual, and partner risk. Further, you will work on building out scalable operational processes to ensure compliance with service level agreements, routine reporting, and overall risk mitigation.  
The right candidate for this role will be passionate about cultivating relationships, educating others in a complex area of risk, possess a strong desire to challenge the status quo, and fervently advocate for creative solutions that support Stripe’s business. Successful candidates for the role will have a minimum of seven years experience in risk, compliance, or legal within payments, fintech, or financial service spaces.  
You Will:

Lead key strategic projects to improve existing operational processes and build new controls ground up within the onboarding space 
Partner with teams across Stripe - engineering, policy,etc to make merchant onboarding experience seamless 
Use data analysis and strong problem solving skills to understand complicated processes and advocate for the right fixes/ improvements to be implemented
Be a thought partner and subject matter expert on all things onboarding at Stripe 
Develop and maintain regional objectives and key results for the GMO team

We’re looking for someone who has:

7+ years of relevant experience with the financial ecosystem;
Excellent written and verbal communication skills;
Advanced proficiency in SQL or other data analysis tools;
Intrinsically motivated; proactively looking to solve problems before they are even identified.

You should include these in your application: 

Your resume and/or LinkedIn profile;

Are you authorized to work in the location(s) you selected in your previous response?
Will you require Stripe to sponsor you for a work permit now or in the future for the location(s) you selected in in your previous response?

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
